title: Syria’s Gas Gambit Brings ConocoPhillips Back Into Play
summary: Syria has just put a big Western flag in its gas patch. title: PC and smartphone markets forecast to shrink in 2026 due to higher prices as memory supply crisis escalates and threatens to spoil Black Friday for PC fans
summary: Get your PC purchases in ASAP, peeps.
body: Market analyst Trendforce is predicting that both the PC and smartphone markets will actually shrink next year as a consequence of the memory supply crisis (via Hankyung.com ). So far, we haven't seen any dramatic increases in PC system prices, but as Black Friday 2025 hoves into view, the question is for how much longer will that remain the case? Trendforce recently downgraded its expectations for 2025 from 1.7% growth for the overall PC market to -2.4% shrinkage. For smartphones, Trendforce revised its figures from 0.1% down to -2%. According to Hankyung, memory accounts for 25% of the cost of AI PCs and 18% of the cost of smartphones. Trendforce reportedly expects laptop prices to rise by five to 15% on account of the 75% increase in RAM module prices that we've already seen. Presumably if memory prices go yet higher, retail system prices will follow. Hankyung also notes that the price of 16 Gb DDR5 chips more than doubled to $24.80 per unit in the month to November 18 on DRAMeXchange . In response, bigger players in the IT industry including Asus and Apple are said to be preemptively purchasing DRAM (and also NAND memory for SSDs), while also discontinuing low-margin products.…

title: Goldman Sachs: Oil Prices To Drop to $53 In 2026
summary: Oil prices are set to further drop into next year from current levels amid a large surplus on the market, with the U.S. benchmark WTI Crude expected to average $53 per barrel in 2026, according to Goldman Sachs. Early on Tuesday, WTI Crude was trading just above $60 per barrel, at $60.09, up by 0.2…

title: Turkish State Oil Giant Launches Landmark $4 Billion Islamic Bond
summary: Turkish Petroleum Corporation (TPAO), the state-owned energy company of Turkey, plans to issue its first-ever Islamic bond of about $4 billion to fund the expansion of its oil and gas production, Turkey’s Energy Minister Alparslan Bayraktar has told Bloomberg.
